description: British English; Colloquial abbreviation for association football, via abbreviation assoc. +‎ -er (slang suffix); earlier socker (1885), also socca (1889), with soccer attested 1888.
Compare contemporary rugger, from Rugby. Similarly constructed coinages from the same period include: brekker (“breakfast”), fresher (“freshman”) and footer (“football”). See Oxford -er.

examples: Synonyms: (UK, formal, rarely used) association football, soccer football, (ambiguous) football; see also Thesaurus:football

verbs.description: soccer (third-person singular simple present soccers, present participle soccering, simple past and past participle soccered)

entries.meaning: (Australian rules football) To kick the football directly off the ground, without using one's hands.
examples: The rule seems to have encouraged players to soccer the ball along the ground.
